DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Edema Symptom Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type symptom (an indication that a person has a condition or disease) of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related limb (a body region referring to an upper or lower extremity) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues).

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Edema Symptom
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a symptom (an indication that a person has a condition or disease) of Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related limb (a body region referring to an upper or lower extremity) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Related; connected or associated.:A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.:Pathological transudate within one or more tissues.(FMA)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: An indication that a person has a condition or disease.  Some examples of symptoms are headache, fever, fatigue, nausea, vomiting, and pain.

Concepts.definition: Subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Edema Symptom Type
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the type of extremity edema symptom.

PermissibleValues.value: Completely resolves with limb elevation and rings/shoes fit without difficulty
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Completely resolves with limb elevation and rings/shoes fit without difficulty

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Completely resolves with limb elevation and rings/shoes fit without difficulty
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Completely resolves with limb elevation and rings/shoes fit without difficulty

PermissibleValues.value: Does not completely resolve with limb elevation or rings/shoes do not fit normally
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Does not completely resolve with limb elevation or rings/shoes do not fit normally

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Does not completely resolve with limb elevation or rings/shoes do not fit normally
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Does not completely resolve with limb elevation or rings/shoes do not fit normally

PermissibleValues.value: No improvement with limb elevation or reduced function
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: No improvement with limb elevation or reduced function

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No improvement with limb elevation or reduced function

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.
